intro: Tristania suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented Tristania, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring opposite, simple leaves with a smooth texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Tristania suaveolens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant aroma.
